snippet: Of the 6,000 detained, authorities said 1,400 did not have proper documentation, leading the minister of public order to say that Greece was suffering an “unprecedented invasion.”
abstract: Athens police operation aimed at identifying illegal immigrants finds that of 6,000 people detained, 1,400 did not have proper documentation, leading the minister of public order to warn that 'invasion' is threatening the stability of the debt-wracked nation; Greece has long been common transit country for impoverished migrants from Africa, Asia and the Middle East; but global economic malaise and revolutions of the Arab Spring have sharply increased the flow of migrants.
lead_paragraph: Of the 6,000 detained, authorities said 1,400 did not have proper documentation, leading the minister of public order to say that Greece was suffering an “unprecedented invasion.”

headline.seo: Vast Police Operation Targets Migrants in Athens
headline.main: As Greece Rounds Up Migrants, Official Says ‘Invasion’ Imperils National Stability
headline.print_headline: As Greece Rounds Up Migrants, Official Says ‘Invasion’ Imperils National Stability
